definition: to hold/to seize/to catch/to apprehend/to take/(used in the same way as 把[ba3]: to mark the following noun as a direct object)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

apex/crown of the head/top/roof/most/to carry on the head/to push to the top/to go against/to replace/to substitute/to be subjected to (an aerial bombing, hailstorm etc)/(slang) to "bump" a forum thread to raise its profile/classifier for headwear, hats, veils etc

sentences.english: He practices standing on his head, in order to accustom himself to any position.
sentences.chinese: 他有时候拿大顶，是为了让自己习惯于各种姿势。

definition: a handstand/to turn upside down/to stand on one's head/upside down
the splits (move in dancing)/to do the splits/Taiwan pr. [pi3 cha1]
drill (in sword play)/to thrash around/to demonstrate gymnastic skills/to solicit financial help (in an indirect way)/to show off
variant of 打把勢|打把势[da3 ba3 shi5]
golden rooster stands on one leg (tai chi posture)/standing on one leg
(of folk artists) to give a performance at a temple fair or on the street etc
